TopicTitle: Same rocket that worked over and over now suddenly crashes and burns over and over.

Articles.Content:
This happen to anyone else?

Edited September 12, 2015 by CosmicCharlie
Any more details? Screenshots? We can't help you otherwise.
If it's literally an identical rocket everytime and you've made no changes what so ever then it's either a bug or pilot error. Other then that you should explain your situation better.

This happen to anyone else?

I love your tiny question.

Correct answer is : YES.

Now mark "answered"

If it's literally an identical rocket everytime and you've made no changes what so ever ---

And if the game's physics haven't changed whatsoever. OP's problem is most likely because of 1.0 aero.

Maybe a broken strut?

Without more info, there's so many maybe's. Do you have TCA (Throttle Controlled Avionics) installed. Sometimes it enables itself and causes... mishaps.

And if the game's physics haven't changed whatsoever. OP's problem is most likely because of 1.0 aero.

This implies he updated to 1.0 and doesn't conform to "you've made no changes what so ever" you are quoting.

I figured it out. But not before I turned it into all struts and fins.

Thx for the responses.

I turned it into all struts and fins.

Sounds like a very Kerbal solution.
